questionTitle: Which of the following is another name for resources mentioned in the following figure?
questionExplanation: A machine instance (physical or virtual) is primarily defined by four essential resources.

questionOption1: Page views or hits on the Web site, as measured in transactions per second
questionOption2: Transactions completed on the database server, as measured by hits per second
questionOption3: Performance logs are a primary source of data that everyone should have available for planning purposes
questionExplanation: There are two important overall workload metrics in the LAMP system.

questionTitle: Which of the following command is used to display the level of CPU activity in Linux?
questionExplanation: sar is installed in Linux as part of the sysstat package.

questionTitle: Which of the following tool captures time-dependent performance data from resources such as a CPU load?
questionExplanation: RRDTool stands for the Round Robin Database tool.

questionOption1: The total workload might be served by a single server instance in the cloud
questionOption2: Performance logs are the only source of performance measurements
questionOption3: The amount of resources to be deployed depends upon the characterization of the Web servers involved, their potential utilization rates, and other factors
questionExplanation: Performance logs are not the only source of performance measurements.

questionTitle: Which of the following tool is used for Web site monitoring service in LAMP?
Which of the following is used as an Open source distributed monitoring system?
questionExplanation: GraphClick is a digitizer that can create a graph from an image.

questionTitle: Which of the following is not a commercial third-party Web site performance monitor?
questionExplanation: Munin is open source network resource monitoring tool.

questionTitle: Which of the following is available as both open source and commercial version?
questionExplanation: ZenOSS is used to monitor operations.

questionTitle: Which of the following testing seeks to answer maximum load that my current system can support?
questionExplanation: Load testing is also referred to as performance testing, reliability testing, stress testing, and volume testing.
